message: I'd like the form to submit with https
is the base page on https?

How can I do that?
watch("#nameForm", "submit");
no it isn't.
my own form? how do I create the action url to KNS ?
you can write your own, but not currently part of the js runtime.
Inspect the requests made by the runtime itself, using your browser's dev tools
i did that but there is a random number in the url it seems
A few resources: http://docs.kynetx.com/docs/Kynetx_Network_Service_API
http://cs.kobj.net/blue/event/web/submit/a1135x48/1305760056591049313973635435104?a1135x48%3AmyTicker=dsds&a1135x48
i'll check ur link
The number is a session ID. Could you call the webhook endpoint?
I tried to call a webhook before but that doesn't work from browsers because of the same origin policy
sorry, my bad.
no worries @rsbohn. It's not a frequently used feature. I just threw it in there because I could.
you can use the webhooks endpoint. plant a script tag, then return js from the webhook.
the random number is just a timestamp, and is there for cachebusting.
submitting directly to the event api is probably a better case here.
